Though he hasn't seen his son in 10 years, John J. Royster has written to the courts from his upstate jail cell asking that he be appointed his son's legal guardian and put in charge of his affairs. The younger Royster is charged with the murder of dry cleaner Evalin Alvarez, the brutal sexual assault on a young pianist in Central Park and the beating of a woman on the East Side .

If convicted, he could face the death penalty. His dad said court-appointed attorneys are not doing enough for his boy. Those lawyers, says the elder Royster, have not prevented police from "parading through the streets and courts like a Vietnam prisoner of war of the Cong." He said the authorities have also inspired a "proliferation of slanderous and infamous 15 to life degree murder last month, Lopez admitted smashing the child's head against a concrete wall, then letting her lie unattended for two days. Always dressed in rags during previous court appearances, Lopez attended her sentencing wearing a dress and heels, with her hair neatly coiffed. Lopez is not alone to blame for Elisa's death, the judge.declared .

Attorney Mitchell Dinnerstein, of the Capital Defender's Office, sloughed off the elder Roster's claims. "We're interested in providing John with the best possible representation," Dinnerstein said. "They helped kill her as far as we're concerned," she said .

Saying Royster's mother, Lynese Sykes Royster, has "abandoned" their son, the jailed dad said he wants to handle the affairs of the son he lost custody of in court years ago. The unusual request, made in court papers filed last month, has caught prosecutors and defense attorneys off guard. The petition will be heard in several weeks, after it is assigned to a civil court judge. Normally, guardians are appointed for grown children when the children are mentally disabled, brain-damaged or otherwise unable to fend for themselves .

The elder Royster does not make such an argument about his 22-year-old son but states merely that he alone has his son's best interests at heart "as the lawful father" and "possessor of great love and affection and devotion" for the accused killer.
